<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span>Finally, a reason to sing happy birthday that has nothing to do with hand washing. The longest-ever U.S. bull market in stocks </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-longest-bull-market-in-history-is-about-to-turn-11-can-it-outrun-the-coronavirus-2020-03-07?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">turns 11</a></span><span> today, but the coronavirus presents an existential threat no one saw coming. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Energy: </strong></span><span>Oil futures fell an incredible 30% last night in their </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/oil-in-freefall-after-saudis-slash-prices-in-all-out-crude-war?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest plunge</a></span><span> since the Gulf War in 1991. We're going to dive into why that happened in 5...4...3...2...</span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
ABC’s Chris Harrison to Join OPEC in Advisory Role
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Chris Harrison laughing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=363 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/131/chris_harrison.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Chris Harrison laughing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/131/chris_harrison.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tonight’s finale of Peter’s <em>Bachelor</em> journey will be drier than 2am PBS paid programming compared to this gnarly spectacle in the oil markets. You might call it the most dramatic OPEC+ meeting yet.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Friday, OPEC ally Russia opted out of a Saudi-spearheaded proposal to deepen crude production cuts. With coronavirus tanking demand, Saudi producers wanted to cap supply to prop up oil prices.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Covid-19 is slated to hamstring global crude demand by </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-russian-deadlock-pushes-brent-crude-to-2-year-low-11583500044?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to 2.1 million barrels per day</a></span><span> in H1 2020, per Goldman Sachs.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Russia was unbothered. </strong>Allegedly tired of 1) <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-07/putin-dumps-mbs-to-start-a-war-on-america-s-shale-oil-industry?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">production cuts favoring U.S. shale producers</a> and 2) holding back energy investments because of the cuts, the Kremlin decided enough was enough.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What that means</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Katy bar the door. Saudi Arabia announced hours after the disastrous meeting that it’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-07/saudis-plan-big-oil-output-hike-beginning-all-out-price-war?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">majorly boosting oil output</a> next month. It also slashed prices for its crude the most in more than 30 years—essentially declaring an all-out price war.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lowering prices = sweetening Saudi crude for refiners in Asia, Europe, and the U.S.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The buy-Saudi-it’s-cheap strategy could immediately force Russia and other producers to rejoin negotiations. One downside: Shares of Saudi Aramco fell below their IPO price for the first time yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">For Saudi Arabia...</strong></span><span>low oil prices are a blow to an economy </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/08/business/saudi-arabia-oil-prices.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heavily dependent on energy</a></span><span>. Some experts say oil could </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/08/opec-deal-collapse-sparks-price-war-20-oil-in-2020-is-coming.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fall to $20 this year</a></span><span>, but the Saudis need about $80/barrel to finance government spending.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">For Russia...</strong></span><span>it can </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-06/putin-is-facing-down-opec-because-his-economy-can-take-the-pain?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handle lower prices</a></span><span> thanks to a far more diversified economy. The country’s breakeven price is about $42, plus it’s been squirreling away billions for rainy days like this one.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>OPEC’s alliance with Russia is crumbling like a Nature Valley bar, and that's brutalizing oil markets. But it also jeopardizes the diplomatic inroads Saudi Arabia and Russia spent the last several years cultivating.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/italy-locks-cultural-epicenter-coronavirus-fears?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Northern Italy on Lockdown
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Empty Milan train station" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzYvbWlsYW5fdHJhaW5fc3RhdGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Emanuele Cremaschi/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the wee hours of Sunday morning, the Italian government announced the most drastic response to the coronavirus outside China: It’s <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/venice-milan-lockdown-italy-announces-sweeping-quarantine-n1152321?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">locking down</a> roughly 16 million people in its northern region. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What that means: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Essentially no one can enter or leave the region of Lombardy and 14 other provinces. Many of the country's famed museums, ski resorts, and theaters will close.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><span>Entrée</span></span><span> spying will get more difficult. Restaurants can stay open as long as customers are seated at a one-meter distance from each other.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This could be <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/07/world/europe/coronavirus-italy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">economically devastating</a>. Anchored by Milan, the north is Italy’s economic crown jewel, with Lombardy accounting for one-fifth of the country’s GDP. Italy itself is the third-largest economy in the EU.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the government thinks the lockdown is a necessary sacrifice considering the alarming spread of coronavirus. Italy has recorded nearly 6,000 cases, at least 233 have died, and hospitals are overrun.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“One of the best health systems in the world, in Lombardy is a step away from collapse,” said the head of the Lombardy regional crisis response unit.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the restrictions will be in place until at least April 3.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/spacex-launches-20th-nasa-mission-nails-50th-landing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
End of an Era for SpaceX
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="SpaceX launches rocket in GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=342 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/130/spacex_launches_rocket_in_gif.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="SpaceX launches rocket in GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/130/spacex_launches_rocket_in_gif.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twelve years ago, SpaceX won a $1.6 billion contract with NASA to send supplies to the International Space Station. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Friday night, in super windy conditions at Cape Canaveral, SpaceX launched the <a href="https://apnews.com/d3c694c7b16fc5890a4ff198b475269c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20th and final delivery</a> using its Dragon capsule under that original contract. Starting in October, it’ll substitute the Dragon with the next-generation Dragon 2, which is bigger and built for human crews. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As is always the case with SpaceX, it’s less about the launch and more about the landing. The company landed its rocket booster for the 50th time in five years. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reusing rockets is key to SpaceX’s mission of making space travel more affordable.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Also pretty cool:</strong> Along with ISS cargo, the mission took dozens of <a href="https://www.issnationallab.org/press-releases/dozens-national-lab-payloads-launch-spacex-crs-20/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mini science experiments</a> to space, some funded by private companies.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Adidas sent up foam particles from its Boost shoe line to see how they’d behave in microgravity. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Delta Faucet Company will be observing how water droplets form in space—apparently, that’ll help it improve one of its showerheads. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Luxembourg startup Space Cargo Unlimited sent up 320 snippets of grapevines. </span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

The Youths Are Smarter Than We Are

</h1>

</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two pieces we read this weekend reminded us that if kids really are the future, we’re in good hands.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The first, from the London Review of Books: </strong>With school suspended until further notice, kids in Wuhan, China, couldn’t believe their luck. That is, until an app called DingTalk entered the equation, allowing teachers to assign homework and conduct online classes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This surely could not stand, so what did the kids do? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They knew that if DingTalk got enough one-star reviews, it would get kicked out of the App Store. So they hammered it.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Overnight, DingTalk’s rating </span><span><a href="https://www.lrb.co.uk/the-paper/v42/n05/wang-xiuying/the-word-from-wuhan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell from 4.9 to 1.4 stars</a></span><span><span>. The app pleaded on social media, “I’m only five years old myself, please don’t kill me.” </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The second, from the New York Times: </strong>Kids on TikTok are becoming literal overnight sensations by <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/06/style/sleep-tiktok-live.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">live-streaming themselves sleeping</a>. They’re even making money, too. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One 18-year-old set up his phone camera, went to bed, and woke up with over 6,000 new followers.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On TikTok’s Chinese counterpart, up to 18.5 million viewers watched </span><span><a href="https://www.abacusnews.com/culture/man-makes-more-us4000-streaming-himself-sleeping-chinas-tiktok/article/3051069?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one man sleep</a></span><span><span> on Feb. 9.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew turns 5 years old on Saturday. So—like every business newsletter before us—we are celebrating our fifth birthday by honoring a hallowed, well-known, and real newsletter tradition: <strong style="color:#000">We are giving away Brew socks and $5,000</strong>. <strong style="color:#000">Here’s how it works...</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong><strong style="color:#000"></strong>All you have to do is refer 5 friends to the Brew this week using your unique referral link, and you’ll receive a pair of the beautiful, blue foot huggers pictured above. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But—and here’s where it really gets exciting—we sneakily put a golden ticket into one package of socks. This golden ticket means one lucky reader will win $5,000 in cash. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Important note: </span><span><strong style="color:#000">It doesn’t matter how many referrals you currently have</strong></span><span>. You need to refer 5 </span><span><em>new</em></span><span> people to receive the fruits of our generosity. Clean slate. Referral rasa. Whatever you want to call it, you need 5 new referrals this week to win.*</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Knock out your 5 referrals today.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today's What Else is Brewing is brought to you by coronavirus.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2020/03/07/coronavirus-grand-princess-airlift-passenger-san-francisco-health-stranded-passengers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Grand Princess</a></span><span>, a coronavirus-stricken cruise ship, will dock at the Port of Oakland today. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/c07bff8f08c76db9f7a5b557b5520f3e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Facebook</a></span><span> said it will ban ads for medical face masks to prevent people from exploiting its platform to incite coronavirus hysteria.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-07/salesforce-asks-california-employees-to-work-remotely-in-march?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Salesforce</a></span><span> joined the growing list of tech companies encouraging California employees to work from home to avoid coronavirus risks.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/lufthansa-mulls-seeking-government-aid-amid-coronavirus-hit?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lufthansa</a></span><span><span>, which cut capacity by 50% last week, is seeking the German government's help to avoid laying off workers.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/boeing-s-new-ceo-regrets-blasting-predecessor-as-backlash-grows?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun</a></span><span>, who tore his predecessor to shreds in a NYT interview last week, said he is “embarrassed and regretful about the article.”</span>
</li>
</ul>

The longest-ever U.S. bull market in stocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-longest-bull-market-in-history-is-about-to-turn-11-can-it-outrun-the-coronavirus-2020-03-07?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eturns 11\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e today, but the coronavirus presents an existential threat no one saw coming. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnergy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOil futures fell an incredible 30% last night in their \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/oil-in-freefall-after-saudis-slash-prices-in-all-out-crude-war?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest plunge\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since the Gulf War in 1991. We're going to dive into why that happened in 5...4...3...2...\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENERGY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nABC’s Chris Harrison to Join OPEC in Advisory Role\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Chris Harrison laughing\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=363 src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/131/chris_harrison.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Chris Harrison laughing\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/131/chris_harrison.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTonight’s finale of Peter’s \u003cem\u003eBachelor\u003c/em\u003e journey will be drier than 2am PBS paid programming compared to this gnarly spectacle in the oil markets. You might call it the most dramatic OPEC+ meeting yet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Friday, OPEC ally Russia opted out of a Saudi-spearheaded proposal to deepen crude production cuts. With coronavirus tanking demand, Saudi producers wanted to cap supply to prop up oil prices.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCovid-19 is slated to hamstring global crude demand by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-russian-deadlock-pushes-brent-crude-to-2-year-low-11583500044?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to 2.1 million barrels per day\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in H1 2020, per Goldman Sachs.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRussia was unbothered. \u003c/strong\u003eAllegedly tired of 1) \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-07/putin-dumps-mbs-to-start-a-war-on-america-s-shale-oil-industry?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproduction cuts favoring U.S. shale producers\u003c/a\u003e and 2) holding back energy investments because of the cuts, the Kremlin decided enough was enough.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat that means\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKaty bar the door. Saudi Arabia announced hours after the disastrous meeting that it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-07/saudis-plan-big-oil-output-hike-beginning-all-out-price-war?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajorly boosting oil output\u003c/a\u003e next month. It also slashed prices for its crude the most in more than 30 years—essentially declaring an all-out price war.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLowering prices = sweetening Saudi crude for refiners in Asia, Europe, and the U.S.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe buy-Saudi-it’s-cheap strategy could immediately force Russia and other producers to rejoin negotiations. One downside: Shares of Saudi Aramco fell below their IPO price for the first time yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Saudi Arabia...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003elow oil prices are a blow to an economy \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/08/business/saudi-arabia-oil-prices.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheavily dependent on energy\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Some experts say oil could \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/08/opec-deal-collapse-sparks-price-war-20-oil-in-2020-is-coming.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efall to $20 this year\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, but the Saudis need about $80/barrel to finance government spending.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Russia...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eit can \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-06/putin-is-facing-down-opec-because-his-economy-can-take-the-pain?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehandle lower prices\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e thanks to a far more diversified economy. The country’s breakeven price is about $42, plus it’s been squirreling away billions for rainy days like this one.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eOPEC’s alliance with Russia is crumbling like a Nature Valley bar, and that's brutalizing oil markets. But it also jeopardizes the diplomatic inroads Saudi Arabia and Russia spent the last several years cultivating.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the wee hours of Sunday morning, the Italian government announced the most drastic response to the coronavirus outside China: It’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/venice-milan-lockdown-italy-announces-sweeping-quarantine-n1152321?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elocking down\u003c/a\u003e roughly 16 million people in its northern region. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat that means: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEssentially no one can enter or leave the region of Lombardy and 14 other provinces. Many of the country's famed museums, ski resorts, and theaters will close.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEntrée\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e spying will get more difficult. Restaurants can stay open as long as customers are seated at a one-meter distance from each other.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis could be \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/07/world/europe/coronavirus-italy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeconomically devastating\u003c/a\u003e. Anchored by Milan, the north is Italy’s economic crown jewel, with Lombardy accounting for one-fifth of the country’s GDP. Italy itself is the third-largest economy in the EU.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the government thinks the lockdown is a necessary sacrifice considering the alarming spread of coronavirus. Italy has recorded nearly 6,000 cases, at least 233 have died, and hospitals are overrun.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“One of the best health systems in the world, in Lombardy is a step away from collapse,” said the head of the Lombardy regional crisis response unit.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe restrictions will be in place until at least April 3.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwelve years ago, SpaceX won a $1.6 billion contract with NASA to send supplies to the International Space Station. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFriday night, in super windy conditions at Cape Canaveral, SpaceX launched the \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/d3c694c7b16fc5890a4ff198b475269c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e20th and final delivery\u003c/a\u003e using its Dragon capsule under that original contract. Starting in October, it’ll substitute the Dragon with the next-generation Dragon 2, which is bigger and built for human crews. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs is always the case with SpaceX, it’s less about the launch and more about the landing. The company landed its rocket booster for the 50th time in five years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReusing rockets is key to SpaceX’s mission of making space travel more affordable.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAlso pretty cool:\u003c/strong\u003e Along with ISS cargo, the mission took dozens of \u003ca href=\"https://www.issnationallab.org/press-releases/dozens-national-lab-payloads-launch-spacex-crs-20/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emini science experiments\u003c/a\u003e to space, some funded by private companies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdidas sent up foam particles from its Boost shoe line to see how they’d behave in microgravity. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDelta Faucet Company will be observing how water droplets form in space—apparently, that’ll help it improve one of its showerheads. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLuxembourg startup Are\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo pieces we read this weekend reminded us that if kids really are the future, we’re in good hands.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe first, from the London Review of Books: \u003c/strong\u003eWith school suspended until further notice, kids in Wuhan, China, couldn’t believe their luck. That is, until an app called DingTalk entered the equation, allowing teachers to assign homework and conduct online classes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis surely could not stand, so what did the kids do? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey knew that if DingTalk got enough one-star reviews, it would get kicked out of the App Store. So they hammered it.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOvernight, DingTalk’s rating \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.lrb.co.uk/the-paper/v42/n05/wang-xiuying/the-word-from-wuhan?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell from 4.9 to 1.4 stars\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. The app pleaded on social media, “I’m only five years old myself, please don’t kill me.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe second, from the New York Times: \u003c/strong\u003eKids on TikTok are becoming literal overnight sensations by \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/06/style/sleep-tiktok-live.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elive-streaming themselves sleeping\u003c/a\u003e. They’re even making money, too. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne 18-year-old set up his phone camera, went to bed, and woke up with over 6,000 new followers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn TikTok’s Chinese counterpart, up to 18.5 million viewers watched \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.abacusnews.com/culture/man-makes-more-us4000-streaming-himself-sleeping-chinas-tiktok/article/3051069?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone man sleep\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Feb. 9.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F08%2Fyoung-tech-users-push-envelope-social-media\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
